text:
What’s easier than our current system? 
Voter ID isn’t voter suppression.

answers.text: @joe_man_child As long as voter ids are free and available for ALL then I don’t see a problem. But in exchange the government needs to make voting easier not harder. More people voted this year than ever cuz more options were available and now Republican led legislators are limiting the options people can use cuz they lost.

@joe_man_child If you believe that voter suppression is not an issue then sadly you are not paying attention. I would never say vote online. I say make voting easier. If people want to vote by mail as we have been doing since the civil war, they should. If ballot boxes are being taken away especially in black neighborhoods like they did in Houston, or polling places are closed down in black neighborhoods on the day of the vote forcing people to travel and stay in long lines how is that not suppression. Make voting easier not harder. I don’t mind a FREE state issued voter ID for all on voting rolls w/o a other IDs in exchange for a national voting holiday so more people don’t have to work in the middle of the week vs exercise their right to vote. Also 1 person 1 vote means the elimination of the electoral college. The people should decide who wins, not electors. I am the elector when I vote. You are the elector when you vote. Yes. 1 person, ONE vote.

@kingblackprogressive there is an issue of voter security not voter suppression. Mail in voting and voting online does not allow for secure elections. It should be 1 person 1 vote in person, with ID. Early, in person voting should be allowed, and those votes should be counted on Election Day.

text: Absolutely right Bruh. Like the way u think
